name: Kingston 480GB A400 SATA 3 2.5" Internal SSD SA400S37/480G - HDD Replacement for Increase Performance
reviews:
['I have used this drive to replace old spinners in laptops. The drive has decreased boot times and increased the general usability of the old laptops by increasing responsiveness. Most recently, replacing the spinner in a tx1320us has been wonderful. If you have an old laptop, an SSD is a great way to get more life out of it for yourself or to refurbish for a someone else in your life.', "Low price got me, plus the name, I've used Kingston memory for years. The SSD drive has worked perfectly for over a month. It replaced an old slow hard drive and is so much faster than the old hard drive. Boot up time is so quick it surprises me. No problems, what more can I say.", 'I have three of these that I’ve purchased, they are between 2-3 years old, and after all this time all three still write well above 450MB/s and just below 500MB/s (transferring large ISOs slow it down a little, nothing bad though) as advertised.

They are sturdy and reliable, run very cool, and I’ve had zero issues with these in the 2-3 years I’ve used them.

I recently took one out of an old Dell (A10 APU laptop that was 10 years old) and use it as a spare drive in my desktop now and it formatted and everything just fine. It flies through all tasks I give it running Dev Drives with Dev Home on Windows 11 Pro Dev Channel and all Linux operations are superb. I even put it through a test benchmark yesterday and it never passed 57 degrees (and I was pushing it hard). Excellent drives that have delivered. I still prefer Crucial for larger capacities, but do not underestimate these, the price/performance ratio is superb.', "I installed this in an 11-year-old Dell Inspiron 7537 to hopefully extend its life by a few years. This - along with a 6 GB ram update - made the computer feel zippy again and almost like new. I bought an open box unit to save money and it looked like new.

To copy my old hard drive data to this new one, I bought a cheap SATA III to USB 3.0 cord. Then I downloaded a free drive cloning program (search online, there are several) and followed a YouTube video on the process. Basically, you connect the cord to the new hard drive and plug it into a USB slot on your computer. Then you run the program which copies all of your data from the old drive to the new drive (took about an hour). Once it's done, that's when you install the new drive and it worked like magic. When I turned my computer back on, everything was there and worked as it should. I wish I had done this sooner!", "I bought this drive about three years ago with the intention of booting Linux Mint off of it. Despite the product description saying so (at least at the time- I didn't check before writing this), THIS IS NOT A DRIVE FOR BOOTING AN OPERATING SYSTEM FROM.
Or rather- it isn't... unless you want to hop into the BIOS and manually tell it to boot from this drive every single time you restart your computer. Which is what I did for 2 out of the 3 years that I've owned it. Why? Because... I didn't know that the drive was the problem. I've got it installed in the Ultrabay in a Thinkpad T440p, and I thought THAT might have something to do with it. I didn't realize that this was the problem until I was doing some research on new drives and saw one of the random techie reviews say this one is NOT a boot drive.
Honestly, I would've returned it if I had known that the drive was the culprit sooner (just because it isn't usable for what I wanted it for and I had no other use for it), so I'm letting ya'll know that before anyone else makes my same mistake. I'm docking one star for an inaccurate product description.
All that said... if you aren't buying it to put an OS on (or you don't care about going into the BIOS every time, I guess), it's a great drive! It's still going strong even after three years, and it's pretty fast.", 'El disco SSD Kingston es una excelente solucion para aquellas personas que quieren una mayor eficiencia en su equipo de escritorio o laptop, sea Mac o PC, dandole al equipo mayor velocidad de transferencia de datos y ejecucion de aplicaciones, juegos y archivos multimedia. Al cambiar tu disco convencional por un disco SSD notas la diferencia en la velocidad del equipo de hasta 10 veces mas de la convencional, recomiendo mucho hacer este upgrade a tu computador ademas de que no seria bulnerable a daños por golpes al no contener partes metalicas. Muy recomendado, ademas de que la marca Kingston es una excelente marca en dispositivos de almacenamiento garantiando calidad en el disco y una garantia excelente.....', '', 'I use these in various capacities for virtual servers with lots of read/write ops for both OS drive and separate data drives. Have yet to have one go into read only mode.', 'I bought the Kingston 480GB A400 SATA 3 2.5" Internal SSD as part of the first computer I built here in the USA. It’s still running perfectly with Windows 10 on the computer I gave to my nephew in mid-2020. Reliable and functional for all needs, with good data read and write speeds.', 'A marca é super confiável', '', 'Atendeu as minhas expectativas, excelente produto e entrega rápida.', '', 'Saved my computer', 'Ótimo custo benefício.', '', "I recently upgraded my laptop by purchasing the Kingston SSD, and the impact on performance has been nothing short of phenomenal. The speed of this SSD is truly remarkable, and it has transformed my computing experience. The improvement is so significant that my laptop now operates at least 10 times faster than before.

The most noticeable change is in the speed at which files load and applications open. Tasks that used to take minutes are now completed in a matter of seconds. The overall responsiveness of my laptop has seen a dramatic boost, making multitasking a breeze. I no longer find myself waiting impatiently for files to load or applications to start.

One of the most impressive aspects of this Kingston SSD is its lightning-fast boot time. My laptop now starts up in a mere 7 seconds, providing me with instant access to my work and reducing downtime substantially. This has been a game-changer for my productivity, especially when time is of the essence.

Beyond the incredible speed, the installation process was straightforward, even for someone with limited technical expertise. The durability and reliability of Kingston as a brand have always been commendable, and this SSD lives up to those standards. In conclusion, I am extremely satisfied with my purchase, and I would highly recommend the Kingston SSD to anyone looking to enhance the performance of their laptop. It's a worthwhile investment that delivers on its promise of speed and efficiency."]

name: Razer Kraken Kitty RGB USB Gaming Headset: THX 7.1 Spatial Surround Sound - Chroma RGB Lighting - Retractable Active Noise Cancelling Mic - Lightweight Aluminum Frame - for PC - Quartz Pink
reviews:
["I've been using this headset for about 6 months, and I'm really liking it!
The sound quality is great, better than any other headset I've used. The sound has helped when playing games a lot compared to my earbuds and my old headset. it also doesn't cause any issues with my glasses which a lot of other headsets do.

The mic is really nice too if you're using it for Discord or gaming but I wouldn't use it for something like streaming. It has a built-in mute button by pressing the mic (and an indicator light for when it's muted so you don't accidentally leave yourself muted) and there's a little wheel on the back of the left earphone to adjust the sound volume.

It's also fully customizable RGB with Razer's Synapse software. You could set each light on the headset to a different color if you wanted to for some reason, and it can also sync up with all other RGB Razer products. I have mine synced with my mouse.

My two biggest issues with the headset are:
1. that I have to have it plugged directly into my computer if I have the lights on.
When I tried using my USB hub, the sound will cut out and the lights will turn off for a handful of seconds at random.

And 2. While it says it has cooling gel in the earcups, I haven't noticed it helping a ton when it comes to my head overheating while wearing the headset for an extended period.

TL;DR
If sound and mic quality are your top priority, you could probably find a better headset for the $140 price, but if you want a cute pink headset that has RGB and matches the other Razer Quartz products and still sounds really nice, I would absolutely recommend it. It also goes on sale quite often, I got mine for under $100.", "Got these babies in 2020 during the pandemic. It was part of my first PC set. Just two months ago, I started having issues:
• Spatial sound and stereo sound switching between eachother (Eventually I had to uninstall spatial sound)

I mainly used my headset for minor gaming so I'm not too sure about what type of sound is great or not, but I've never had an issue and the sound display has always been clear for me. Headset doesn't give me any issues but they are a little big. I used them almost 4-5 times a week the past 4 years (reduced usage a lot this year due to other needs), and on some days it was for long periods of time as well. They've lasted me at least 4 years without any issues and honestly, they've been great for me so far. The mic quality is also so much better than some headsets out there that are more than $100+.

Another thing, some headsets usually start falling apart after lots of usage. The cushion for the ears are leather but they've never once ripped, began flaking or anything of the sort. A little FYI that I didn't do too much to take care of them except put them on a stand and clean them every once in a while.", "This is the very first headset that I've bought for gaming and I love it! I wanted a cute headset so the aesthetic already was enticing and so is the brand (my husband has a headset from the same brand). I wouldn't really consider myself experienced with technology/gaming so I can't quite give a detailed and super informative review for specific parts of the headset but...
as far as I'm aware, sound quality/cancellation is amazing. It really feels like the headset cancels out other noises besides my own voice, of course. It was very [eerily] quiet when I first put them on because it felt like I was all alone in my head with my thoughts. But when I started streaming, I ended up getting used to it as well as hearing my own voice clearly (like, I know it's my voice, but it felt a little bit like I was hearing it from another perspective). It's a strange feeling and a new experience for me, but I like it. It's also quite comfortable and I love that I can pull out the little mic part. OOH and also, pretty colors! It lights up, which makes it look even cuter!
For my first gaming headset, I would definitely recommend it <3", "I'd give these suicide prone headphones 9.5/10 For great style and audio quality. Downside is the microphone is barely average and you'll have to replace the whole damn thing about every 2-3 years. I'd highly recommend buying the three year protection plan because the cord coils in on itself and destroys itself. I've had these last just over 2 years before the audio starts to cut in and out and becomes unbearable.

Irregardless if I have to make an asurion claim every 2-3 years for a busted ass cord, these are by far my favorite headphones. They're cute, sparkly, comfortable, and have amazing audio quality. Exchanging these every 2 years just seems like a headphone tune up to me. Get the 3 year plan and you'll be alright", "So... I have slowly begun to realize that Razor headphone mics break within a year usage. I have tried several types including this one (my friend owning the pink) and my brother also owning a different pair but the mics do not last very long. One day they are working and the next... well... they don't.

With the kitty one's (my friend including) one of our ear pieces also blew out? She had the pink version and I had the black and both just... had the left ear blow and the mic just stopped working as well.

It really sucks because the headphones are SUPER cute! I love them a lot but they are not worth the price if you get barely a year usage out of them... But hey! They are great otherwise, at first they are great, the mic quality is decent, the sound is great, they are decent at noise cancelling when you have nothing playing but again that whole year usage is kind of a damper for the price that I pay.", 'El mejor sonido! Muy cute y con muy buena calidad, ya tengo los rosas y los negros 😻😻😻', '', 'Razer Kraken es una marca ya muy reconocida para todos los gamer y una vez mas no fallan:

Pros:
1- Están hermosos, no soy mucho del color rosa pero se ven muy bonitos.
2- Están super solidos, ya que tienen metal al nivel del audífono en lugar del plástico que se encuentra en mucho sets lo cual me encanto ya que se me rompieron otros de otra marca.
3- Están super cómodos. Tengo lentes y los uso para trabajar, les he usado 8 horas seguidas sin tener dolores de cabeza o oreja. Son bastante ligeros comparado a otro set que tenido.
4- Me gusto la calidad en general del sonido, los colores, el software permite hacer muchas cosas padres.
5- Lo puedo usar en mi celular con un adaptador, que también compre en amazon, sin problema.

Con:
1- Al usar con un celular ya no se puede guardar el efecto de los colores, solamente se queda en un solo color de base.', '', 'Bisher bin ich total zufrieden mit Razer, der Preis hatte mich anfangs etwas abgeschreckt, aber es ist es wert!
Der Sound ist mega, die Mikroqualität ist top und es ist alles individuell einstellbar über die Razer App zb. Sound oder Beleuchtung. 👍
Einziger manko: wenn man doch mal untern Tisch krauchen sollte und die Katzenöhrchen beim hochkommen vergisst 😂', '', 'Parfait, bon rapport qualité prix', '', 'Cuestan una pasta y ya ni si quiera puedo darles uso, tampoco me tramitan la devolución, es mas, se limitan a ignorar mis mensajes.
Los auriculares los he comprado y devuelto 3 veces incluso en distintas tiendas, este modelo concretamente debió salir con algún tipo de fallo, por que los primeros meses se escuchan genial, tu audio es muy limpio y el micrófono tiene una cancelación de ruido exterior impecable, PERO...
No han hecho un año en las tres ocasiones y dejan de funcionar a medias, en mi caso, sin golpes, torceduras de cable o maltrato de los mismos mis fallos han sido:
Voz robotizada a días, depende de como se despierten los auriculares ese día.
Desconexión constante de los auriculares que lleva consigo que tu ordenador se congele esos segundos que se "va y vuelve" el audio.
Fallo de audio en uno de los lados, completamente aleatorio.
En mi caso el más común fue el de desconexión y conexión de los auriculares, por que literalmente tu ordenador detecta que estas jugando a enchufar y desenchufar los auriculares, y no se puede solucionar con drivers ni ninguna aplicación especifica de sonido, mucho menos con la app de Razer.
Como dato extra pesan bastante, si eres propenso a las migrañas ni pienses en comprarlos, por que te destruyen la cabeza.
Por lo demás insonorizan genial, y el audio es muy bueno y de muy buena calidad.
El micrófono pues eso, se escucha muy natural, muy regulable y una cancelación muy buena, si tienes alguien al lado no se escucha a esa persona.
Una pena que duren tan poco y te den la espalda con la garantía.', '']

name: Logitech M330 SILENT PLUS Wireless Mouse, 2.4GHz with USB Nano Receiver, 1000 DPI Optical Tracking, 18 Month Battery Life, Compatible with PC, Mac, Laptop, Chromebook - Black
reviews:
["I wanted a silent mouse or as close as possible so my clicking wouldn't disturb my wife.

I have large hands but find that a small mouse works well and don't expect it to fit my palm. My grip on the mouse is fingertips only and have grown used to travel mice. I find the fingertip grip gives me more delicate control of mouse movements than a large ergonomic mouse does.

I let my wife try the mouse and she loved it so we had to buy a second mouse. She has smaller hands and it fits her palm nicely. The clicks are nearly silent. The scroll wheel has a nice feel to it, just enough tactile feedback to let me know it's working.

We haven't measured the life of the battery in it but it seems to last a few months at least.

We both appreciate the wake up feature of the mouse. Just moving it wakes it up. We have had mice that required a click to waken and find those very annoying because the wake up click would often result in an unwanted screen click.

Neither of us are gamers and can't offer any information but the mice do seem to be very sensitive and responsive. I did experience some frustrating lag with the mouse for a time but changing the receiver dongle to a USB 3.0 port took care of the problem. It wasn't caused by the mouse. I still don't understand why a USB port suddenly gets weird and slow but it does happen with some computers. We run older desktop tower computers with Linux systems so the occasional issues could be either the hardware or caused by some random software update. Switching ports seems to take care of the problem.", "This is the first nonstandard mouse I've ever had and the shape is very, very comfortable for my hand to sit on. The 'off button' is hidden on the bottom and I worried about going through batteries too fast when I forget to turn it off.
I still forget all the time and the first battery has lasted me two months and counting so far, even though it gets multiple hours of use every single day. I would buy this same one again today if it were to break.", "The Logitech M330 SILENT PLUS Wireless Mouse has revolutionized my computing experience, and I am eager to share my thoughts on this exceptional peripheral. As someone who values a peaceful environment and seamless functionality, this mouse has exceeded my expectations in every aspect.

First and foremost, the standout feature of this mouse is its silent operation. The near-silent clicks and ultra-quiet scrolling make it a game-changer for those who work in shared spaces, libraries, or quiet offices. The reduction in noise is remarkable and has significantly contributed to a more tranquil and focused work environment.

In addition to its silent operation, the mouse maintains Logitech's renowned standard of quality and performance. The ergonomic design fits comfortably in my hand, providing a natural grip that minimizes strain during extended use. The wireless connectivity via the 2.4GHz receiver ensures a reliable and lag-free connection, offering the freedom to work without being tethered to the computer.

The battery life of the M330 SILENT PLUS is impressive, delivering up to 24 months of usage on a single AA battery. This exceptional longevity means that I can go about my work without the inconvenience of frequently replacing or recharging the battery.

The precision and responsiveness of the mouse are outstanding, allowing for smooth and accurate cursor control across various surfaces. Whether I'm working on a desk, couch, or even my lap, the mouse tracks consistently and reliably.

Setup was a breeze, as the mouse is plug-and-play, requiring no additional software installation. This simplicity, combined with the reliable wireless connectivity, ensures a hassle-free user experience.

In summary, the Logitech M330 SILENT PLUS Wireless Mouse has become an indispensable tool for my daily computing needs. Its silent operation, ergonomic design, long battery life, and reliable performance have elevated my productivity and comfort during work hours.

Pros:
1. Near-silent clicks and ultra-quiet scrolling enhance the work environment.
2. Comfortable and ergonomic design reduces hand strain during extended use.
3. Long battery life of up to 24 months minimizes interruptions.
4. Reliable wireless connectivity via the 2.4GHz receiver.
5. Plug-and-play setup for a hassle-free user experience.

Cons:
I have not encountered any drawbacks with this mouse. It has proven to be an exceptional addition to my computing setup.

In conclusion, the Logitech M330 SILENT PLUS Wireless Mouse has set a new standard for quiet and efficient computing. Its silent operation, ergonomic design, and reliable performance make it a standout choice for anyone seeking a comfortable and unobtrusive computing experience. I highly recommend it to individuals working in shared environments or anyone who values a peaceful workspace.", 'If you are looking for a silent mouse that does not stand out from the crowd, that feels great to the touch, are right-handed, and do not mind to pay a little bit more, then look no further, because this is the mouse for you. Haha, it may sound like I am advertising, but I'm really not. It's just an overall a good mouse.

However, do note a few cons before purchasing the product:
- Only has 3 buttons (left-click, right-click, and a scroller): nothing else fancy
- Might be a little on the small side of sizes when it comes to big hands (might lean towards a "claw grip" for comfortable usage

The rest, whatever you can think of a good mouse, is all there as pros for this Logitech mouse:
- Great ergonomic (especially for right-hand users)
- Very smooth tracking
- Even though people mention the mouse sleeps, it does great tracking and wakes up like it wasn't even asleep in the first place (does not lag)
- Compact and sturdy, while being lightweight
- Great for long-term usage
- Very silent indeed! More silent than how most laptop keyboards sound.

Last but not least, gaming. If you plan to game with this mouse, it's doable, but as I have mentioned previously, it may be better to get a gaming mouse for better ergonomic (and full size hands feel). Otherwise, this Logitech mouse does offer great DPI, so gaming is possible (just like any other mouse would do).', 'Na primeira foto, minha experiência como cliente não foi agradável, pois apesar de bem protegido pela embalagem inflável e o mouse estar dentro de um "saquinho", não veio ao menos na caixinha e o manual.

Os desenhos laterais não são exatamente iguais do anúncio, porém é detalhe de baixa relevância e não é emborrachado. Prefiro assim pois é melhor para limpar.
Na parte de baixo, o que me levou a crer na originalidade do produto é o que mesmo tem detalhes brilhantes em baixo relevo (Ex: a inscrição M330) assim como é demonstrado em produtos originais na fábrica pois produtos falsificados não tem detalhe nenhum, é mal construído e material de baixa qualidade.

Clique SILENCIOSO sim!

Resumo: Gostei do produto, mas como não veio manual, espero não precisar usar uma garantia do produto e ter problemas por isso.', '', 'Good quality right price', 'Logitech es mi marca favorita en mouse, los clicks son bastante silenciosos.

name: Intel® Core™ i5-14600KF New Gaming Desktop Processor 14 cores (6 P-cores + 8 E-cores) - Unlocked
reviews:
['This professional CPU isn't designed for the average user. However, if you're a tinkerer at heart, eager to dive deeper than the surface-level information often presented in YouTube "videos" (or should we say, commercials), this is unquestionably for you. I've acquired multiple units for various builds/configurations from a wide array of retailers—Best Buy, Newegg, and others included.

For those considering making a purchase, I highly recommend using an Apex/Apex Encore MOBO or another reputable 2 DIMM board, particularly for AM5 or LGA1700, if overclocking is your goal. A high-quality cooler is crucial; for those opting for an AIO, ensure it includes at least an 8th gen Asetek pump and a 360 Thickboy copper radiator with performance fans—

Avoid the aesthetically pleasing but functionally inferior Lian Li reversed SL Infinity Fans. Genuine static pressure fans, capable of efficiently doing the job, are what you need. Despite what your favorite YouTuber might suggest, you should prioritize efficiency over aesthetics.

When selecting DDR5, opt for GOOD BINNED options. If a high-binned QVL compatible set isn't your choice, at a minimum, go for HYNIX A for single rank and HYNIX M for dual rank.

The 14900K, when expertly tuned, becomes a gaming and multitasking powerhouse—achieving 43 to 44k in R23, with 6.2GHz boosting, 5.9GHz across its 8 physical cores and 8 threads, and 16 physical e-cores at 4.7GHz for a total of 32 threads, of which only 8 are virtual. With hyper-threading and e-cores enabled, it supports 8200 to 8400 MTS CL38 DDR5 RAM, boasts sub-55ns bus latency, and sub-9.3ns FWL. It's a marvel in Aida64 full, minus SSD, burn-in stress test stability. Adjusting all cores down to 5.8 and boosting to 6.0 can further reduce bus latency to easily below 50ns...

Did I mention overall CPU temperatures typically remain between 35 to 40°C under heavy gaming loads, rarely exceeding 50°C? Despite the capability of 3 EATX connections to easily deliver over 400W of power, I'd advise against exceeding 325W daily, as the performance gains beyond this point are minimal without extreme overclocking and cooling methods—increased voltage requirements could significantly shorten the lifespan of your CPU. For tinkerers, this CPU is a dream come true.

name: SteelSeries Rival 3 - Gaming Mouse - 8,500 CPI TrueMove Core Optical Sensor - 6 Programmable Buttons - Split Trigger Buttons
reviews:
['Works as well as their more expensive steelseries mice.', 'The mouse is amazing and responsive, but as in the headline, the right click started making strange clicking/squeaking noises within 3 months.', 'In terms of design, the matte texture of it is very nice especially if your palms get sweaty a lot. It also works very well and is easily adjustable. Very solid purchase!', 'Only con...the STEELSERIES application has to run constantly in the background in order for the color/light settings to apply. The DPI settings can be uploaded to the mouse itself...but somehow the lighting settings cant!?

Make it make sense...

I think I might just disable the lighting completely since it functions like a rainbow without the application running.', 'Muy buena compra, recomendable', '', 'So, I intended to use this mouse with an M1 mac. Unfortunately, while the mouse works great without any drivers, configuring other properties of the mouse requires the SteelSeries engine software, which at the time of writing isn't compatible with M1 macs. Fortunately, I was able to install the engine on another machine, connect the mouse, and then configure the settings. To my surprise, the settings appear to be stored in the mouse, so if you connect it to another machine they'll still take effect. This includes things like mapping mouse buttons to keyboard buttons (e.g., I mapped the "forward" button to shift), which even work in virtual machines!

Anyway, the mouse itself is inexpensive, the tracking is good, and the ability to configure the buttons and have it persist between machines is pretty awesome. I rated it a 4/5 on ergonomics for me personally because I have large hands, but I'm sure someone with normal hands would find it comfortable.', 'My entire life i've used office mice. My best of which was my trusty Logitech M185.
How I loved that mouse. But now i've got a new sweetheart it's name is Rival 3.
It "skates" on my mousepad likglass and is perfect for my smedium hands with claw grip but fingertip would work excellent aswell. Overall give it a try my performance in FPS games is now alot more consistent and for the money can't beat it.', 'Bought this one as an "Amazon's Choice", because it seemed pretty good-looking for the price. Upon getting it plugged in, I discovered that I had to download the company's proprietary software to change ANYTHING about the mouse. Annoying, but alright.

It was a little obtuse to get around, but I only ever wanted to be able to use my middle mouse button to change the light colors, so I can't speak for the actual utility.

Then, the software stopped working (Or rather, I think I had to ALWAYS HAVE THE SOFTWARE OPEN in order for any of it to work). Again, obnoxious, but I can live with just setting it to one color. By now, I already didn't like it that much, but I figured this was me getting my money's worth in the bad way.

Then, the MOUSE stopped working. At random intervals, it would just...stop responding. I would have to reset it in order to make it work again, and doing so would basically force-reset every other device on my USB hub (Keyboard, headset, webcam - as annoying as it sounds).

I started troubleshooting. It wasn't the port. It wasn't the hub. It wasn't the fact that it was IN a hub. It still did this with different keyboards, and with everything else unplugged. It has continued to do this at least once, and usually closer to five times (three or four times while I was writing this review), every day until I finally bother to replace it.

Overall, it just...doesn't work. I might've just gotten a faulty mouse, but I'm mostly just astounded by the fact that it's SO bad that it's affecting OTHER devices. Just save up some more and spend 40 on a mid-line gaming mouse or something.

name: SteelSeries Arctis Nova Pro Multi-System Gaming Headset - Premium Hi-Fi Drivers, Hi-Res Audio - 360° Spatial Audio - GameDAC Gen 2 - ESS Sabre Quad-DAC - Stealth Retractable Mic - PC, PS5, PS4, Switch
reviews:
['I am writing this review after an initial 2 weeks. I will come back and update if I have insightful longer term updates to provide.

Before jumping into my $.02 I think it's useful to prefix review input with past experiences and what I'm comparing my product against.
When thinking about music and overall sound quality, I have Apple AirPod Max's that blow these things out of the water. These can't touch the Max's bass, nor do they sound as smooth and natural out of the box (as everyone has said, these are quite flat out of the box). I also have SennHeiser MB660s that have been my work conference/music-at-the-desk and occasionally my gaming headphones w/o a mic and even they sound far, far better for music and even in some games (assuming OOB setup, not fully configured with Sonar).

I am also going to address the lack of ANC outside of the pros/cons list, because I think the use cases of this headset are unique compared to general over the hear headphones. Despite my opinion, I do think it's odd the wireless version of these have ANC and these don't. However, I think if you want pure, fairly competitive or natural and detailed game sound quality above all else, you do not want ANC hissing and adding pressure to your ear. If you haven't owned in or over ear headphones with ANC you might not realize that the constant pressure they create on your ears cancelling out noise will fatigue your ears for long gaming sessions. I also don't think when I need to hear footsteps exactly where they are around me and where they're going in Warzone that I want to try to separate ANC hiss from game noise. I guess this could be easily addressed by putting the feature in the headphones and letting the game profile turn it on off.

PROS:
- the sound profile is very flat out of the box. I think that opens the most options wit the Sonar EQ software to adjust them to more peoples preferences.
- if you read this and are a gamer who plays games that has voice chat, I totally under-estimated and under-valued what the GameDac can do. The GG software splits up game sound, your game mic, and your game chat mix into 3 individual audio streams. The best part of this, is games like Warzone let you split which audio device the game uses for those audio outputs. You can then press the dial on the dac once and adjust the output between chat and game sound. This means I can dynamically adjust hearing my team or the game - if people have low mics, are mumbling, or are obnoxious children blaring music into their mic during the game I can curtail that instantaneously.
- despite no ANC the ear cushions do a really good job of blocking out most sound
- I think the ear muffs and head band could be more comfortable than my Sennheisers and AirPod Maxes. These things just disappear on my head. I have never gamed more than an hour and a half straight without taking them off, but I thought nothing of them being on my head for that long.
- the mic is excellent, especially with the ClearVoice "AI" filter
- the game presets are pretty good out of the box. the sound quality and clarity are excellent. despite lacking in music impact, I have to admit these are probably are setup as they should to give the most accurate, clear in game sound. the sound imaging to pinpoint players is spot on, the volume levels are good. I cannot take these more than 75% in war zone without hurting my ears.

CONS:
- the Sonar software component of the GG suite requires a SteelSeries account to enable. This is totally unacceptable and just shows where SteelSeries is trying to monetize by getting your e-mail address. I have never found an aspect of Sonar that requires SteelSeries knowing who I am or utilizing an account to manage or enable my product.
- I don't think if you're an audio snob you'll have a jack of all trades headset. as I mentioned above I have at least 2 over ear headphones that aren't even in the same solar system for music
- stop buying the hype about the marginal better sound quality from the DAC. 99/100 normal people with untrained ears with average hearing can't tell the difference between compressed bluetooth audio and lossless wired headphones, all else equal. I bought the wired because I have so many bluetooth or wireless devices in my headset that when I want to game, I do not want interruptions, drop outs, hitches or blips.', 'Short version: It’s a really good headset on its own but once you combine it with the GameDAC the customization it allows is something everyone should spend a little time to learn to personalize it best.

Long version: Everything about this headset goes above and beyond. As long as you know the basics in your audio settings it’s as simple as plug and play. Though combine that with their steel series software (which btw compared to the software of other brands like razor for example, steel series software barely touches any resources and will not be a hindrance to have running in the background.) The pads around the ears are soft and very comfortable allowing for wearing as long as you’d like. At no point is there ever really discomfort. The GameDAC with the software makes it easy to control your volume using the smooth to the touch dial and a very simple interface that is easy to understand with a useful little tutorial on how to use it. This overall should be good enough for the general consumer to get their hands on this thing but for audiophiles, they get to have their cake and eat it too! The software allows you to play with an equalizer in the software that also has the audio split between several categories (Game, Chat, Media, Aux, and Mic). So you can set your Game channel to allow you to gain the advantage in your game or allow you to have a more immersive experience. Along side that you can have the Media channel to make whatever you watch or listen to sound as crisp as possible allowing you to enjoy every little detail to your favorite songs and movies.

Overall phenomenal product and I recommended it for anyone looking for a quality headset without shelling out $500+ one some “super duper high quality headset” when for this price gets ya right up there for a fraction of the cost.', "The left ear did not work when it came out of the box also I got mine from Best buy just to get it the same day cuz I'm impatient. When I was comparing apples to apples the dial on the one from Amazon did not feel completely smooth it felt almost as if there was small piece of stuck in there kind of similar to how the dial feels after years of use. The one from Best buy that was not defective was super duper smooth when turning the knob.. obviously it'll be different sellers that you're buying it from but just know that the dial should be super smooth you should feel absolutely no obstruction and the headset is very loud if it's not very loud it's defective. The right ear that did work was not very loud. The one I got from Best buy that was working properly was very loud. I am still going to write five stars as the item came very quick and the item was as described. It is not the seller's fault that the manufacturer had a defective item.", 'Very happy with these headphones work well with my x box series x', 'Simplesmente, o melhor headset gamer do mundo! Steelseries simplesmente quis se desprender desse slogan de fone gamer, áudio emulado. Lançaram um fone com um dac lendário que é o ESS SABRE, que possui um nível de detalhamento sensacional. Conforto deste fone é algo abismal de bom, parece que você não tem nada na sua cabeça, diferentemente de um astro por aí. Digo e repito: O melhor fone gamer do mundo!', '', 'Exelente audio de lo mejor si tienes el dinero para darte el lujo :)', '', 'The headset is top quality and fits perfectly i average gaming sessions that last hours and it’s comfy and the sound quality is top tier would recommend.', 'I’ve been a gamer for a long time and been through many headsets. This out does all of them.

It’s multi gaming function allows you to have two gaming systems connected to it at once, with a user interface that allows you to switch between them without having to move from your seat.

The headset is very comfortable to wear, and the sound quality is brilliant. Recipients have also said that in crystal clear when talking, too.

It has a retractable microphone to keep it safe when not playing, too.

Great headset and well worth what we paid.']

name: Logitech G903 LIGHTSPEED Wireless Gaming Mouse W/ Hero 25K Sensor, PowerPlay Compatible, 140+ Hour with Rechargeable Battery and Lightsync RGB, Ambidextrous, 107G+10G optional, 25,600 DPI, Black
reviews:
['I'm on my computer for work all day long, so I'm always on the lookout for great accessories that make my life easier, and this mouse is one of them. It's a little pricey, but it's very responsive across multiple surfaces and feels great in my hand. That said, I do have a few minor complaints.

First of all, I bought the charging pad with my mouse and it worked great for about 6 months. Then I lost the USB dongle in a move so I purchased a replacement mouse, but even though it's recognized and shows up in the Logitech G Hub software, the pad have never charged the mouse since and I have no idea why. That said, I can charge the mouse with a USB cable from <15% to 100% in a couple of hours and a full charge last for weeks even with heavy use so it's not a huge deal, although it might suggest that the rather expensive charging pad isn't really worth the expense.

Second, there's a button next to the mouse wheel that switches the wheel from free spinning to tensioned mode where the mouse will stop moving as soon as you stop pushing it. I like the free spinning mode as it's a great way to quickly jump around a long document or web page, but the wheel on this model is very loose and tends to scroll drift the instant you lift your finger off the wheel even if you've stopped the movement several times by gently pressing down on the wheel. I've owned many different mice over the years and this is the first one where the wheel was so loose it would constantly drift like that, and I know it's specific to the model because I own 3 of these mice for my various personal and work computers and they all exhibit the same behavior.

Finally, I always reassign one of my mouse buttons to double-click. I've learned over the years that if I physically double-click the little metal tab under the mouse button fatigues in less than a year and starts doing that annoying double-click when you only clicked once thing, so I always assign a button and use that instead. Now, there's no problem assigning a button to double-click, the catch is the G Hub software. It has this really obnoxious thing where it auto sleeps after like 5-10 minutes of mouse inactivity, so when you move your mouse again it plays a loud ding and for a couple seconds only basic left click and right click work before G Hub wakes up and pushes the custom button assignments into the mouse again.

I've spoken with tech support at Logitech and there is no way to prevent G Hub from auto sleeping, that's just the way the software is designed, but there is a mouse memory mode. Basically, instead of communicating constantly with G Hub, you can just have the mouse "remember" its button assignments in a kind of offline mode. So no need for G Hub and no need for that annoying pause every time I move my mouse after reading for a few minutes. Except for some reason double-click is in a category of button assignments that doesn't qualify for the mouse memory mode, and according to tech support there's no way to get around that, which is kind of a bummer.

Anyway, that's about it. I do like the mouse, but there is room for improvement in my book.', 'I purchased 3 mice and was all set to send the most expensive one back. I kept it instead. Although a bit large, I can move it around easily, access buttons and enjoy the sensitive touch.it is very quiet.

It is a "game changer" for me as I have several health issues that interfere with my gaming. This mouse solves these issues .', 'It is now March 2024, and I have been using my G903 Lightspeed since early 2021. After 3 years, this mouse has been reliable, comfortable, and great for either hand.

I found it naturally easier to use left handed for some reason, but I mimicked that grip with my right hand, and it works equally well. I switch hands sometimes to minimize chances of repetitive stress injury when working all day. I reverse the mouse buttons digitally, using system settings.

One thing I especially love is the replacement side buttons (normally for forward and back in a browser). The mouse comes with static / fake replacement buttons, which are held on quickly with in-built magnets, and I use them on both sides so that I never worry about clicking them by accident. Great feature if you truly use it ambidextrously!

The only thing negative I can say is that sometimes the sides are slightly slick depending on how my hand is that day. It is rare that it affects my use, but I wish they would have put a small strip of smooth rubber to negate this. Usually hand warm from using the mouse rids this problem.', "I bought this a year ago in the attempt to find a wireless mouse that behaved like a good old fashioned wired mouse.

All other wireless mice I have tried were very unstable as far as the the pointer lag and intermittent movement goes. There was no way to learn where the pointer would end up as it would move, skip, stop, move again, etc while simply moving the mouse either slowly or quickly. Horrible tracking.

The only thing that worked accurately was an ancient wired microsoft mouse I had.
My mouse 'pad' is the arm of the couch made of a fitted velour type cloth that came with the couch.
I tried a blue tooth optical mouse, jumpy. Splurged on the flagship model of logitech that tracks on glass, also jumpy. Sent that thing back. Didn't like the strange shape either.

I then tried this one. It uses a different usb dongle which works on a different frequency and higher speed for the radio connection. Success! This mouse tracks very well. No jumping around or skipping of movement at all, just like the wired mouse.

I think it is because it uses 'Light speed wireless' as the connection rather than bluetooth or wifi.

It has a reputation of bad switches from the other reviews. Only now is it showing some minor signs of the switches being imperfect and that is hardly noticeable so far. I have sourced replacements for them when they do go bad.

Battery life is fairly good. Not nearly as good as the old kind that used 2 AA batteries. Maybe 1-2 months with heavy use and turned on 24/7. Old ones that use AA (blue tooth) last more like a year or more.

The settings can be stored on the mouse itself so no need to have to have some software running all the time to retain settings. The software it uses is Logitech G Hub. I'm on Win7 and used an older version of that. If I allow it to update itself, it will fail to run on Win7. Once you have setup your switches, LED colors, etc and stored that on the mouse, the Logitech software can be terminated and set to not start as a windows service. I have turned off all the LEDs since the nice lights consume power from the battery.

Excellent mouse overall.", 'Esta increible el tiempo que aguanta la carga en si me encanta no eh tenido ni un problema con el mio lo eh cuidado muy bien y ta chevere ty', '', 'My old G502 was starting to show trace of it age so I decided to upgrade to a wireless mouse and boy I am satisfied! Love the fact that this mouse still have the "free wheel" scroll, quite useful in work environment (ex. :Get to the bottom of THAT Excel Sheet). Battery life is OK but could be greater,m probably those RGB eating all the power.', 'Lo pedí una vez y le faltó una pieza yo creo que fue un error de empaquetado, pero el mouse se veía excelente, así que lo pedí de nuevo y ahora si venía perfecto, ya lo probé y funciona muyy bien, así que satisfecha con el producto :)', '', 'El mouse entregado es uno claramente usado, y ni si quiera para limpiarlo un poco para entregarlo y fingir que no es así. Lo probaré un poco y si no lo devolveré inmediatamente.', '', 'G-series mice are generally small. The G502, G604 right-handed "ergonomic" designs leave a void in the ball of the thumb. It's too narrow, especially if held with ring finger on right-click, middle finger on scroll wheel(aka 1-3-1 grip). If you use 1-3-1 grip, ambidextrous mouse fits best.

G903 fits well. The hard side surfaces on G903 has an advantage over typical soft rubber/silicone sides because it's resistant to pinkie finger nails digging a crater in the soft material over time. I prefer the hard, easy to clean surfaces

There are enough reviews about the double-click issue for me to expect a button replacement down the road. Quality control isn't good enough at this price.

EDIT:
As expected, left switch died, not responding; I replaced both switches. Have since used many other models(mostly razers) and I'm increasing my rating from 4 to 5 stars. This is still one of my favourites, because of it's mix of gaming and productivity features; Gaming mouse with a hyperscroll wheel is rare.

G903 is similar to G Pro, except g-pro lighter, caters to gaming no hyperscroll.

It's shape would be better with higher mid section. Add optical switches, AA battery option, bluetooth, usb-c usb dongle holder, and it would be perfect!', "I am a right-handed person, the ambidextrous design bothers some people, but I find it comfortable.

I use the thumb buttons for push-to-talk(PTT), one for in-game PTT, other for discord, etc, PTT.
Don't bother trying to use the buttons opposite to your thumb side(at least not for gaming), it's a very awkward reach.
Hyperscroll is very good for websites, the non-hyperscroll is very tactile and suitable for gaming.
DPI changer is fine, but I don't really use it often.
No latency. Apparently, it's supposed to be faster than wired, but honestly you can't tell the difference.
Sensors are technically supposed to be more accurate than the old model, not really humanly discernible considering how accurate sensors are nowadays.

I'm an original G903 owner, so the rest of the review will be in comparison to the old version of the G903, which, in my opinion, was the best mouse.

Snagged this for $150, $50 cheaper than what I paid for the original G903 when it first came out.

Please take into account the fact that I have lighting disabled, it really adds nothing to the experience.
I'm leaving this review because it arrived at half charge and after two weeks of non-stop usage, the battery finally went down to 3 percent. Charge is really fast too. After about a minute, the battery went to 20%. Amazing.

Low battery indicator is not obnoxious like it is on the old G903. The old model would flash red and would be really distracting, the new model is more like a fade in and out really slowly, so it's not annoying the crap out of me.

Icons in the logitech software still don't load properly, however, a reinstall which I am too lazy to do might fix it, regardless, everything is still functional in it. The UI doesn't look like it was designed a decade ago, which is a plus I guess.

Don't get the powerplay mat, it's pointless when the battery life is this good. Just charge it once a month while you're watching a TV show episode, and you're good. Off switch is pretty pointless considering it has a seamless auto-sleep function, only necessary for travelling."]

reviews:

The Modular Design lets you only plug in what is needed to make the system work, which allows you to avoid unnecessary clutter of unused cables unlike traditional PSU's. if i apply the concept of this power supply to building a PC, the Cable Management will be much easier as you will have extra space to store excess cables and can retain the unused cables in your box outside of the case until needed.

I was able to boot, and bench test (Cinnebench 2024) my system and this Unit didn't spin the cooling fan up once for the first 5 minutes of the test. Once the fan kicked on it was so unbelievably quiet. My current system has an EVGA 650W power supply in it and that thing sounds like a leaf blower sometimes. I plan on Building y system once my case arrives, and will update my review about installation and cable management, and include a few pictures to boot. Overall first impressions i would Definitely recommend this to people who need a great power supply with intuitive modular cable management for cases like the Corsair 4000.', "It's a power supply. Captain Stinky here has been rock solid since I first booted up the system I powered it with, though, so it's not much of a complaint.", "subtle branding with plenty of in box cables that are tied to not be messy. After installing the PC booted right up and was back in action. The noise level is much quieter on this PSU than the original one, and everything is running great.', 'Easy to install, clear connection ports and labels. Great value for your money. name: ARCTIC MX-4 (4 g) - Premium Performance Thermal Paste for All Processors (CPU, GPU - PC), Very high Thermal Conductivity, Long Durability, Safe Application, Non-Conductive, CPU Thermal Paste
reviews:
["I have an AMD RX5700XT which have a common issues of producing a lot of heat. Temps were nearing 110c after an hour of pc gaming which I don't think would be good in the long run. After using this my gpu stays in 90-100c after hours of gaming which I believe is acceptable.

But the main reason I bought this thermal paste was because my one year old AMD ryzen 5 5600 cpu started to overheat and my pc would shutdown, I put this thermal paste on and my cpu and now its 49c when idle where it used to be like 65-70c idle.

So yeah it got the job done and I'm thankful.", "It's thermal paste. You apply it on the CPU, spread it or leave it as a dot, and then apply the cooler. Nothing more. This one is easy to spread, so there's no mess.

If this is $5 or less, I would usually recommend going with this instead of the MX-6, which usually goes for around $10. MX-6 is slightly better, but it's not 2x better.", 'We were at our National competitions with close to 100 degree weather and our motor was running close to 130 the previous race, with a few drops of this and our heatsink on our go kart. It keep the motor at around 115. Great product, will buy more and this time do more tests with more application of it under our heatsink.', "The ARCTIC MX-4 thermal paste is a staple in my electronics toolkit, and I consider it one of the best for maintaining various devices. It’s an ideal choice for replacing old or inferior stock thermal paste in everything from family Nintendo Switches to my personal computers and laptops. This paste provides excellent thermal conductivity, ensuring devices run cooler and more efficiently.

For anyone with electronics that use thermal paste, like older gaming consoles in need of refurbishment, I strongly recommend using ARCTIC MX-4. If the idea of replacing thermal paste seems daunting, there are numerous instructional videos on YouTube that can guide you through the process. With a bit of patience and the right research, you'll find the task rewarding and vital for preventing the overheating issues that can lead to premature hardware failure.", 'Fast delivery', 'Easy to use. Cheap. Good at keeping things cool. Just be careful with it around your motherboard pins it càn get stuck in them. Other than that 1 tube could probably do at least 3 motherboards worth of thermal paste so good size per tube. Overally good quality and value for money', "I used to use Arctic Silver 5 back in the dday, but I was very impressed with the Arctic product. Just a pea-sized dot will get you going. I cleaned the pre-applied paste off of my old Corsair AIO water pump cooler and applied it to my new R7 5700X, and it is cooling beautifully, boosting from 3.5Ghz all the way up to 4.65Ghz under full load and staying at barely 80C. Then I applied to my new R5 7600X with SAMA AIO cooler and it would not run past 75C at 5.5Ghz.

I did not like the paste that came with the SAMA cooler, it was not pre-applied and it came out of the tube all thick and rubbery, very difficult to spread, but the ARCTIC MX-4 was VERY EASY to apply, and easy to control the amount. I'm not sure how much 4grams is, but I think I have enough left to apply at least 2-3 more cpus if I ever needd to. Highly recommended!", "My i7 averages per specs 94c and maxes at 100c.
I stay around 40 all the time and maybe high 60s under high load now.
Impossible!!

Update after lots of use: My processor's spec sheet states 94c idle, 100c high load. My max is also 100c. I always just thought turbo would last maybe 3 seconds or until you reach max temp. Take a look at this paste! I am idling at 28c (82f) and under any type of load I am maxing at 59c (138f).
But the main plus in all this ... I keep a full monitoring app in my system tray and noticed at 100% load, at max turbo which is 3.9 (base 2.8), it stays under 60c and never throttled down during the entire operation I was doing (I think video conversion or file compression). Not to mention, I never hear my fan. This was a hot laptop and was specked by Intel to run that hot. So, for anyone who thinks paste isn't so important, think again. Imagine running at full Mhz?! I played Half-Life with my discreet Nvidia 930MX and my thermals stayed the same. I still have half the tube left after a dual die processor and GPU. Maybe I'll hit the PS3 next.... I thought to use the new MX-6 but heard such great things about this one. Maybe I'll try the new edition in a few years.", 'Si que me ayudo, y me sobro bastante, muy buen producto, redujo 15 grados de temperatura', '', 'Gostei', '', "As someone who builds and maintains their own computer systems, I am always on the lookout for high-quality thermal paste to use in my builds. Recently, I purchased the ARCTIC MX-4 (4 g) Premium Performance Thermal Paste and I have been extremely impressed with its performance.

One of the standout features of the ARCTIC MX-4 is its high thermal conductivity. It is designed to provide optimal heat transfer from the processor or graphics card to the heatsink, which helps to keep the components cool even under heavy loads. This is especially important for gamers and other power users who demand the highest levels of performance from their systems.

Another great feature of the ARCTIC MX-4 is its long durability. Unlike some other thermal pastes that tend to dry out and lose effectiveness over time, the MX-4 is designed to last for years without any degradation in performance. This means that you won't have to worry about replacing the thermal paste on your CPU or GPU for quite some time.

In terms of safety, the ARCTIC MX-4 is an excellent choice. It is non-conductive and non-capacitive, which means that it won't cause any damage to your components if it comes into contact with them. Additionally, it is very easy to apply, thanks to its non-viscous consistency, which makes it spread easily and evenly.

Overall, I have been extremely happy with my purchase of the ARCTIC MX-4 Premium Performance Thermal Paste. Its combination of high thermal conductivity, long durability, and safe application make it an excellent choice for anyone who wants to keep their computer running cool and performing at its best. Whether you are a gamer, a content creator, or just someone who demands the highest levels of performance from their system, the ARCTIC MX-4 is definitely worth considering.", 'My Ryzen 7 7800X3D Loves it', "Facile à appliquer et très efficace. J'ai noté une nette baisse des températures de mon processeur. Rapport qualité-prix imbattable. Je recommande vivement !", '']

name: ASUS TUF Gaming NVIDIA GeForce RTX™ 4070 Ti Super White OC Edition Gaming Graphics Card (PCIe 4.0, 16GB GDDR6X, HDMI 2.1a, DisplayPort 1.4a)
reviews:
['This arrived completely undamaged! I had a very nice unboxing experience thanks to the way this card is packaged. You know you bought something of quality when you open the box.

This card was installed in a new build which is as follows:

Ryzen 7800x3d CPU
MSI Pro B650-P Wifi Motherboard
DeepCool AK620 Zero Dark
32 GB Corsair Vengeance DDR5 6000mhz AMD Memory (CMH32GX5M2B6000Z30K) @5200mhz Expo
Asus Tuf RTX 4070 Ti Super 16GB Video Card
Creative Audigy FX V2 Sound Card
Corsair RM1200e 1200W Power Supply (Overkill I know)
Fractal Meshify 2 RGB Case (Amazing Case)
Windows 11 Home

Upgraded from the following system:

Intel i7 11700 CPU
MSI Z490-A Pro Motherboard
Corsair H100x 240mm AIO
32 GBs Corsair Vengeance DDR4 PC3600 Memory
Nvidia RTX 3070 FE
Creative Audigy FX V2 Sound Card
Corsair RM750 750W Power Supply
Corsair 4000D Case (Excellent Case Also)
Windows 11 Home

It performs flawlessly! The upgrade from an RTX 3070 is massive. Along with the CPU upgrade to a 7800x3d, my frame rates at 1440p have more than doubled. I have a 165 HZ MSI Mag274QRF-QD monitor that I limit to 163 HZ globally. Most of my currently installed games (World of Warcraft, Dying Light 2, FallOut 76, FarCry 6, GTAV, Fortnight, etc) are getting frame rates at or near the 163 HZ limit, at ultra settings (No Ray Tracing or DLSS 3 except in Dying Light 2, and that game looks amazing and still gets over 100 fps!).

I am also using a second MSI monitor (Mag274 @1080P) for chat and communications programs while gaming, and as usual with Nvidia video cards this has no problems with 2 monitors, both using display port.

The Asus Tuf RTX 4070 Ti Super never gets very warm. I think once I saw it at 60C. Its basically always in the 50C range while gaming. I am sure the 140mm fans of the Meshify 2 RGB help this.

The card itself is quite big, and feels very well built and sturdy. The anti sag support that Asus included worked well, but I switched it to a beefier aftermarket version that I like better.

I only have one con, and that is the cost. To be a PC gamer is very expensive, and this is the biggest expense! It is a lot of money. I think most people who purchase cards like this, myself included, are planning on using it a long time to help offset the cost somewhat.

The warranty is 3 years, I mistakenly thought it was 4 years. Perhaps wishful thinking :)

I am planning on enjoying this card for at least 4 to 5 years. At 1440p I am sure it will be just fine for that amount of time. Other than the cost I have no cons, it is a fantastic video card and the best one I have ever owned!

Please Note: I will most likely will be receiving a 90 day warranty extension from Asus for writing this review.', "1, I refuse to pay 1000 dollars for a GPU, 2, New GPUs come out every 3 - 7 months so after so long the card becomes obsolete in a few months. 3, the reason why I bought a 4070ti 16 GB is that it can fit in my case with no problems also they make a water block for this GPU. As far as FPS, I do not think I would need over 100 frames to play a game. I just didn't buy this card just for games. I plan to do some creative work with this card too. Some say it's a beautiful card, but we need to say how is it going to perform. Back in the good old days,
anything over 30 FPS was considered to be great, now everyone is saying 100 frames is good. Once again, how high are we supposed to go, or how high are we supposed to spend? I saw a review on here where someone said they worked and saved up $25.00 a week for so many months just to pay for a 1500 dollar GPU, to me that is 1500 dollars out of his life and time. Now remember the 50 series is supposed to be coming out in 2024, OH I guess you will sell your 40 series for a high price for a used card to make up the difference, this is why I will not pay $1000 dollars for a GPU because no matter what you pay, you still paying for a overpriced card. Every card I paid for was used, this is the first card I ever paid for that was new. And now that I own it, I wonder how long before it becomes obsolete. I trying to say I don't see things like you do. To me it's just a GPU to you it's beautiful, to me im looking for performance.", 'Just built my big gaming pc I play alot of different games and I like them looking good with no hesitation this was the perfect gpu for my build.

Make sure you have a case big enough to fit this gpu and be sure to have a gpu support of some sort a sturdy one it is a bit heavy', "Runs great, good price, and I liked that it didn't have a lot of color. I built a new rig and went all black with subtle low white ringed fans. It looks awesome. Like some cold Cyberpunk city. Like that game Syndicate wars. Now which of you remembers that game!", "I've had this card for a couple of days now. Simple to install, even in my older mid-tower case. It replaced my well served Zotac 1080 GTX. Only have tried a few newer games, but at 3440X1440 on Ultra with DLSS on quality, this thing does deliver. Framerates hover around 90-100. Compared to my 1080, this runs much hotter, so make sure you have a case with good ventilation to keep it cool. As for noise levels, it's as quiet as my 1080 so far. Very happy with this card so far.", "Pros:
It does exactly what you need it to. Plays current games on max settings, no heating issues and the brute force computing has saved me from a fair few crashed from unoptimized games i.e. helldivers 2

Con: it's massive make sure you have a bit of space to make sure it fits. I had no issues but I have a MASSIVE case. A mid tower might not accommodate this if you don't have PERFECT cable management.", 'It didn’t work in my computer I am building. I knew it ran by the lights and sounds it made when I powered it on. The seller is a great person to work with. I was able to ship it back, no problem. Will I buy from them again? Hell yeah! I will need more parts in the future after better research on my build.', 'Although pricy, I think it’s well worth the money when it’s compared to a 4070 for example. There are major differences between what they can run and their limits. FPS are no problem in games, I usually see it perform very well. Personally loved the build and it matched perfectly with the aesthetic I was going for. Since the graphics card is big and heavy, I recommend finding a support stand for it. It’s also not as noisy as I thought it would be, I have the PC on top of my desk next to me when I use it and the noise is not a bother to me. The bonuses that come in the box are pretty cool as well, it comes with some stickers, a keychain, a phone holder, and a version of its own Pokémon except it’s the graphics card with its own stats. It was a cool little bonus that I didn’t expect.', 'Excelente rendimiento', '', 'Love this card but, one week in, I've been getting black screen with fans spooling up at max while in the middle of some games (World of Warships, to name one). I'm seeing the same issue with the 4000 series NVIDIA GPUs from other people across many forums (NVIDIA, Tom's Hardware, Guru 3D, Reddit and so on), with the "solution" being anywhere from cabling to drivers, MoBo/GPU BIOS, control panel power settings, clean driver/ OS install, and much much more with no actual fix in sight. I'm running the Corsair 12VHPWR Type-4 PSU sleeved Power Cable off an RM850 PSU; I've been told the adapter that comes with the card is usually the problem, but may have to revert to the adapter for further troubleshooting. Would love to hear from others.', 'La ocupé para un segundo equipo y si desempeño en 4K con streaming simultáneo ha sido el esperado.', '', 'This card has made a big difference in my experience with MSFS and especially with VR
I am impressed with how Hirt it remains during some heavy loads and the cooling system does seem to do a very efficient job.
It’s certainly not a cheap card but it does give good value considering the performance I am getting.
It’s a big card though so check to see if you do have the room to install!', 'Excelente producto con muy buena relación calidad precio. Actualmente es la mejor oferta que se puede encontrar para hacerse con una de estas GPU. Rinde fenomenal sin necesidad de hacer overclock, ideal para jugar a cualquier título por encima de los 100 FPS estables, alcanzando grandes cotas sin necesidad de habilitar DLSS o alguna tecnología similar. El modelo en venta en efecto es la ASUS TUF-RTX 4070Ti Super. Solo hay que procurar tener espacio suficiente en gabinete, ya que la tarjeta es muy grande al alcanzar casi los 33 cm de largo y pesar poco más de 1 Kg. Es bueno saber que cuenta con un soporte para evitar que se doble la ranura PCI por el peso de la tarjeta.
Muy recomendable para jugar por encima de lo 100 FPS a resolución QHD o más de 60 FPS a 4K.', '']
